actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Subcommittee on Civil Service Discharged.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service. H. Rept. 101-180.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 119.
Mr. McCloskey moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-87.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To extend by 1 year a program under which the Government is allowed to accept the voluntary services of private-sector executives.

summary.text: Amends the Executive Exchange Program Voluntary Services Act of 1986 to extend the Executive Exchange Program for one year.

titles.title: To extend by 1 year a program under which the Government is allowed to accept the voluntary services of private-sector executives.
